item.title: Poetry
item.content:encoded:
Books

  • ./code --poetry - Collection (Broken Sleep Books) & code-poetry.com (collaboration with Daniel Holden) - 2023 (first edition self-published 2016)

  • Extra Long Matches - Chapbook - Penteract Press - 2022

  • Nam Gal Sips Clark - Collection - Hesterglock Press - 2021

  • Citidyll - Pamphlet - Broken Sleep Books - 2018

Collaborations

  • ‘Last Thrusters’, a V[R]erse with Mez Breeze

  • ‘Echolocation’, sound poetry with Susie Campbell

  • ‘Submarine’, ‘Alphanumeric’, ‘Avalanche of Stars’ and ‘Firefighting’ with Daniel Holden - Welcome to the Jungle

  • ‘Barotrauma’ with Daniel Holden - Battalion (Sidekick Books)

    • Spotlight by Jon Stone

  • ‘Barotrauma’ (video) with Daniel Holden - Tentacular

Poems (online)

  • ‘Skeuomorph’ - DUSIE

  • ‘A-CuTe’ - Aww-Struck Poem Atlas exhibition

  • ‘O’ - Perverse

  • Three pieces - Beir Bua Journal

  • Five pieces - Coven Poetry

  • Three visual poems - The Babel Tower Notice Board [offline]

  • ‘selenium semilune’ - Escapisms Poem Atlas exhibition

  • ‘Bird Strike’ and ‘Antarctic See’ - Anthropocene

  • Three poems - Blackbox Manifold

  • 'Inland Sea Bride' and 'Transference' - Adjacent Pineapple [offline]

  • 'Multiplexiglass' - The Literateur [archived]

  • 'Routine Comedy' - Ink, Sweat & Tears [offline]

Poems (print)

  • ‘Butter?’ - aswirl (issue one)

  • ‘Undiscovered Elements’ - DISEASE - Carnaval Press and sunseekers

  • ‘Mildred’ - Trickhouse Press: 2022 Annual

  • ‘Periodic table squares - Alchemy’, ‘Adrenochrome’ and ‘Human mineral cycle’ in Seen as Read anthology - Kingston University Press

  • ‘OsIr’ and ‘Promethium’ - The Book of Penteract

  • ‘Bus factor’ and ‘CAD’ - code::art (Issue 1)

  • ‘XR’ - Mote 5, Edinburgh, January 2020

  • Broken Sleep Books Anthology 2018, Broken Sleep Books

  • 'A Abductee' - It All Radiates Outwards, Verve Poetry Press

  • 'The Lorelei' and 'Fire Safety' - Haverthorn Magazine (V. 3.2)

  • 'The Golden Spiral' - Oxford Poetry (XVI.ii / Summer 2016)

  • 'Foxglove' - Under the Radar (Issue 17)

  • 'Chernobyl' - Ambit (Issue 222)

Exhibition

“I’ve land mined redder denim DNA, Levi” featured in TEXTUS: in-between text and textile at the Torriano Meeting House, 8 July - 3 September 2023. Exhibition curated by Keziah Florin-Sefton and Lottie McCrindell

Poem films

Twitter bot

  • @coriolavirus

Readings

  • Online launch of ./code --poetry with Daniel Holden (Broken Sleep Books), 31 March 2023

  • Reading at Richard Marshall's Fichtean Landscapes event at St John's Church, Bethnal Green, London, 25 November 2022

  • Collaboration with Madame Cryptica, European Poetry Festival (Sweden), London, 16 June 2022

  • Optimizing Code for Performance: Reading ./code --poetry, 19 May 2022 at University of Hamburg (featuring Daniel Holden and introduced by Dr Wiebke Vorrath)

  • Reading at the Printed Poetry Project event at Writers’ Kingston, 5 April 2022

  • Reading from The Book of Penteract (with Susie Campbell & Teo Eve) at Writers’ Kingston, 15 March 2022

  • Collaboration with Susie Campbell at Sound Poetry event at Writers’ Kingston, 1 February 2022

  • Reading at Sampson Low Celebration event at Writers’ Kingston, 15 December 2021

  • Collaboration with Virna Teixeira at European Poetry Festival (Norway), Ealing, 23 November 2021

  • Launch of Nam Gal Sips Clark at Poem Brut event at Writers’ Kingston, 10 November 2021

  • Reading at Poem Brut event at Open Ealing, 14 August 2021

  • City of London, 10 June 2021 at Poem Brut #16 - City

  • Reading from my pamphlet Citidyll at Broken Sleep Books 2018 showcase, 7 May 2021

  • Willesden Gallery, London, 19 April 2021 at the launch of Tereza Stehlikova & SJ Fowler’s exhibition A HISTORY OF UNNECESSARY DEVELOPMENTS

  • Cinema Museum, London, 29 August 2019 at the launch of SJ Fowler’s I STAND ALONE BY THE DEVILS AND OTHER POEMS ON FILMS

  • Fjender poetry: The Maintenant Group reading, 15 March 2014

Reviews/mentions of my work

  • Interviewed by Wes Brown in Episode 2 of his Broken Heroes podcast

  • Mentioned in TEXTUS at the Torriano by Nancy Mattson

  • Included in Leia Butler’s list of “incredible creators”

  • Episode 11 of the Full House Lit Mag podcast includes discussion of my poem ‘O’, published in Perverse April 2021

  • Eye Candy article about @coriolavirus Twitter bot by Peggy Nelson

  • Broken Sleep Books Anthology 2018 Steve Spence, Litter [archived]

  • Mentioned in an interview with Aaron Kent by Belle Kenyon

  • Included in Marian Christie’s 2022: End of year reflections

  • References to ./code --poetry, my collaboration with Daniel Holden:

    • “What is Code Poetry?” by Daniel Temkin in Hyperallergic, 21 August 2023

    • “Unter der Oberfläche?
      Programmierte Schriftlichkeit in digitaler Lyrik      ” by Wiebke Vorrath in Schriftlichkeit: Aktivität, Agentialität und Aktanten der Schrift (transcript Verlag, 2022) pp. 62-63.

    • “Code and poetry” by Élise Duverdier, Medium, 18 August 2021

    • Keynote: On the Aesthetics of Code - Sy Brand - CPPP 2021

    • “Code, Poetry and Freedom” by Jorge Forero, xCoAx 2021, p. 270.

    • “Is code poetry the new avant garde” - talk by Laura Caccia, TedX London

    • Included in Backslash Lit’s Inspo

    • Mentioned on Pixel Envy by Nick Heer

    • Mentioned by Krzysztof Siejkowski, author of codepoems.xyz

    • Code poetry: Poems written in programming languages by Nađa Božović, 8 January 2018

    • Mentioned in “Practising Ada’s ‘Poetical Science’” by Kari Kraus, 18 April 2017

    • “Code poetry challenges the meaning of creativity and visual arts” by Madison Moore - Software Development Times, February 16 2017

    • Goodreads reviews

    • “Code-Poesie: Gedichte die in Programmiersprachen geschrieben sind” by Kristina Dosen, 4 June 2018

Editorial

  • In 2016 I edited a section of Meniscus magazine.

  • In 2015 I co-edited Magma 62 with Kayo Chingonyi on the theme of 'Violence'. I also edited Sarah Fletcher's pamphlet, Kissing Angles, for Dead Ink Books.

Reviews by me

  • Magma 72 (review online)

  • Magma 68

  • Hix Eros (2013)

Other writing

My (small press) writing day - 2021

item.title: Bio
item.content:encoded:
About me

Chris Kerr lives in London. He is the co-author of ./code --poetry with Daniel Holden, published by Broken Sleep Books in 2023. His chapbook, Extra Long Matches, was published by Penteract Press in 2022. His debut collection, Nam Gal Sips Clark, was published by Hesterglock Press in 2021. His first pamphlet, Citidyll, was published by Broken Sleep Books in 2018.

His work has appeared in Ambit, Anthropocene, Adjacent Pineapple, Blackbox Manifold, code::art, Haverthorn, Oxford Poetry, The Literateur, Poem Atlas, Tentacular, The Babel Tower Notice Board, The Book of Penteract, Under the Radar and Ink, Sweat & Tears.

Chris was commended in the Verve Poetry Festival City Poetry Competition 2018. He was shortlisted for the Jane Martin Poetry Prize in 2017.

Contact

Thank you!

item.title: Synaesthesia
item.content:encoded:
Synaesthesia

A poetry video game

Instructions

You are the “i” in “synaesthesia”. Make new words by pushing the other letters around. Can you make “ah yeastiness”, an anagram of “synaesthesia”?

To play the game:

  1. Click the game area above

  2. Use the arrow or WASD keys to move the “i”

To start again, reload the page. This game only works on desktop devices, not mobile.

If you like, you can share screenshots of the words you make on Twitter or Instagram with the hashtag #synaesthesiapoetrygame

Poem film

A poem film created from a playthrough of an earlier version of Synaesthesia. Published by Writers’ Kingston.
